title: Pure joy!
text: What gem. Vegetarian and vegan menu with lots of choices! Amazing handmade nachos and out of this world Buddha bowls. We sat outside and enjoyed an amazing service with a smile from the owner Jay and the multilingual Edvin. We will definitely be returning!!

title: Brilliant
text: Excellent experience overall. Great pizzas in reasonable prices and great service. Friendly and efficient. Well spoken English too (not at all common at this part of the world). Two pizzas and two large beers for 18 euros. Definitely recommended!!

title: Loved it
text: There is no way to make a reservation online and without speaking Italian we were hesitant to call the landline number. We just showed up on a Wednesday evening and luckily we managed to get a table as the place soon became full. We loved everything about it. Food and service were abundant and fun. The wine was not the best we ever tasted but we still drank it all. Great tastes and lots of food for a 25 euros fixed per person price.

title: Beautiful
text: Absolutely brilliant experience in every way. From the booking, the service and the food. Nothing was trouble and we loved everything. We had the starter and pasta of the day (tartar swordfish and inked pasta), and also marinated anchovies and Sicilian pasta. We shared a second (mixed grill). We had two beers and wine. Paid 93 euros and did not regret a single cent. Definitely recommended!

title: Terrible service
text: We asked for a table at 21:30 walking-in as we saw four empty tables outside. The waitress asked the manager's opinion. He said that there were no available tables outside (although they were four with no reservation note on them) and he could offer us a table inside. His attitude was upsetting. No effort to accommodate customers at all. The restaurant was closing at eleven and we made an online reservation (through fork app) without any issue for 10 min later (which we cancelled straight afterwards as we had no mood to give their appalling behaviour any further chance). We are certain it is covid to blame (not).

title: Nice but not exciting
text: I feel that the main reason failed to excite me is because I have visited many major art galleries in different places. This is rather small and basic permanent exhibition but with substantial diversity so that most people will find something that speaks to them. Lowry, Dali, Picasso, Rothko, Kandinsky. However the layout is not of my taste, distracting from the exhibits (why all this metallic cages??). I always find the contemporary exhibitions far more interesting.

title: Wonderul
text: Great all day breakfast and extremely reasonable prices. Service friendly and efficient. Much preferable to any chain coffee shops. Nice to observe the great variety of customers too.

title: Cozy and authentic
text: We loved the hospitality and food on a cold January night! Nice people and cozy warm environment inside. Everything was tasty in decent portions including the amazing deserts (do not miss the saragli with ice-cream). We had 6 dishes, 2 deserts and house wine and paid 55 euros. Definitely recommended!

title: Famous steps
text: This is a typical touristy restaurant at a beautiful area of Athens (anafiotika steps). As expected the food and service were average. Sit outside for some ouzo and minimum mezzes to avoid feeling robbed due to the really average quality. We will not be returning.

title: Steps of giants
text:
I visit every time when in Athens. The symbolism is amazing on what humanity can achieve. Better hire a tour guide if you haven't done your homework. The ticket is half price Nov to Mar. Enjoy the walk around the walls and visit the new museum. Wear comfortable clothes as you can walk around the most beautiful areas of Athens (plaka, anafiotika, monastiraki) as well.
P.S: The stolen marbles of Elgin must be returned!

title: Food Vs Service
text: Visited without a reservation and were lucky to find a table. The food was really good, but the service needs a lot of work. From the host smoking outside to the waiter moping the floor and moving straight to serving without washing his hands. Please fix the service because the food was really tasty.

title: Brilliant!
text: Amazing little place. Centrally located, with excellent small plates till 11.30 turns to a vibrant bar after midnight until early in the morning. Service was excellent. We had a LOT of rakomelo and 8 plates and ended up paying 50 euros. Definitely recommended!

title: Hidden gem
text: This is an Indian restaurant well hidden but definitely worth the effort. Living in the UK we had all kind of experience with Indian food. Here we were not disappointed. The decor is cozy and the service efficient. We could alter the level of spiciness too! Not too much curry to mask everything else and the paratha was great. Recommended!

title: Great overall
text: Great small place for wine and nibbles. We were sat in the back and had two bottles of red wine. We loved the cheese options! Enjoyed the music and the excellent service. We'll be returning!

title: No concept
text: No idea why a simple, average coffee shop in a quite neighborhood praises itself as a unique concept. Average coffee and food. Average service. Too many other options unless you live nearby.

title: Lovely
text: Great place when not too busy for traditional coffee and cookies. Great service with a smile! We would love more savoury choices to make it perfect!!

title: Wonderful
text: Beautiful small place (as suggested by the name) in a busy road of the city center. Homemade food of great variety, tasty and affordable. Amazing service by Fani! Definitely recommended.

title: Excellent!
text: Beautiful place in a downtown location. We visited on a Monday night and were treated to some great live music while enjoying our wine and shareable plates. We will be returning !!

title: Route66
text: Nice photo opp as you can pull over and walk the bridge. It's probably way more beautiful when rainy. We liked it as part of history.

title: Nice!
text: Closed Monday and Tuesday! Lovely little store and nice photo opp with the cars characters. Kids will love it.

title: Another 66 photo opp
text: Nice quirky shop and across the meadow gold sign. We didn't find the shop open but enjoyed the setting nevertheless.

title: Hmmm
text: Ok. First of all we have visited numerous faves all around the world. These are not something spectacular, but they are really nice. The guiding script is good (humorous) but not much geology information. The idea of switching on/off the lights is annoying and the use of colour lights is just ridiculous. Does everything have to be a show? The patriotic clip at the end was NOT of our taste and ruined the whole experience.

title: Awesome!
text: We loved it. Like time travel. Like live salvage hunters. George was kind and generous. Great photo opp!!

title: Golden?
text: Well it's a nice photo opp but the guy ain't golden. Looks like advertising income took over. It's a shame really.

title: It's a whale!
text: It's a must on route 66. It's quirky and a nice photo opportunity. We liked it. There are some tables to enjoy your refreshment as well. The story behind it is lovely too.

title: Lovely
text: Lovely antique store and very friendly service. From records and jewelry to furniture and route66 souvenirs. Thank you!

title: Great!!
text: Nice food and great service. Chicken was cooked nicely and fries were excellent. We loved the decor with the wooden booths. Decent prices too! Recommended!!

title: What a shame
text: Location is great. Five min walk to the arch. Everything else is average. We had major issues with the room although we had booked it 9 months in advance (no Aircon) and we were offered breakfast as a reward. There was non bin in the bathroom and you have to pay extra for everything (WiFi, parking, breakfast). It was just a night. We will not be returning.
place: Hilton St. Louis Downtown At The Arch

title: Brilliant
text: Great food and nice service. At the outskirts of Cuba (the mural city) on the route66. We had the double platter X2 and 4 sides with two beers and desert. Sat upstairs at the balcony and enjoyed everything. Total cost 40 dollars. Recommended!

title: It's a big Arch!
text: We loved it. The claustrophobic shuttle, the views from the top, the gift store. Staff friendly and accommodating. A must if you visit St Louis!

title: A must for any chess enthusiast
text: Amazing little museum with temporary exhibitions (We loved the MC Escher art) and a permanent chess exhibition on the top floor. Lovely q boutique store. Just across the st Louis chess club!

title: Great photo opportunity
text: Awesome place for some pictures and on the way to Hicks BBQ too! We loved it. Unfortunately the store is closed on Sundays.

title: The real deal
text: Excellent welcoming little cafe with very nice people offering great pies and refreshments. Just opposite to the big Paul. Had the peach pie with ice-cream and coffee. Loved it!

title: Yass!
text: A must stop for the giant gemini! We loved the smal gift shop and the hot dogs. Great service and value. Well done!

title: Average
text: Apart from the convenient location there was nothing we liked about this hotel. Definitely not 4star! Noisy, tired (especially the bathroom) and basic. Practically impossible to connect to the wi-fi. The Lockwood restaurant ceiling is beautiful so a visit for a drink would be sufficient.

title: Very slow service
text: We sat outside on a Friday afternoon and it was really busy. Ale (daisy cutter) was good but the grand margarita average. The nacho platter was large and tasty. Service was very slow as we waiting for the bill 30 min after asking for it three times (20% gratuity felt like a rip off)

title: Hot dog!
text: Loved our hot dog and fresh lemonade by the park. Ha! As American as they come, specially on a sunny day. Give it a try!

title: Beautiful
text: Don't miss it (how could you anyway!). Walk around. Take pics of the bean and the fountain. Enjoy a beer. Loved it.

title: Such a shame
text: Beautiful rooftop bar at an amazing location. Would be perfect after a long walk at the Lakeshore, but no-one attended out table for 35 minutes to take our order. The place was practically empty at 20.00 on Thursday evening. Music was too loud too (like being in a club). Beer and food was nice but the experience was ruined.

title: Hmmm
text: Nice scenery at the café dock (if you can find a table). Mocha was average. The shop is nice although we expected fewer commercial products. Unfortunately the strawberry picking was closed

title: All you can eat buffet
text: It is an all you can eat buffet. There is a lot of variety and most of the dishes are decent. Do not expect any gastronomic fireworks. If you are on a budget and not ordering any alcohol then you might enjoy it. Service is efficient - It was not crowded when we visited so we overstayed at our table. Overall not my cup of tea, but for 20 quid you get a LOT of food.

title: Loved it
text: Excellent option for tapas and great wine. High ceilings and less noisy than the NQ one. We enjoyed 9 tapas dishes, a bottle of rose wine and paid 90 quid), The service was friendly and efficient. We missed the aubergine from the menu (NQ) but loved the stuffed peppers. We will definitely be returning.

title: Awesome
text: Amazing! We visited on the day it was announced a world heritage UNESCO site. It's is a beautiful site with amazing history. Great for scientifically stimulating discussions and an outdoor picnic at the gardens. We would love to see it moving but unfortunately some maintenance work is being carried out. We will be returning!

title: Really nice
text: This is a family run gastropub with some very interesting menu choices (Mediterranean oriented). The setting is beautiful inside and at the rear garden. There is ample parking in the back. We really enjoyed the meze platter and the goats cheese for starters. The sunday roast slow beef was cooked to perfection. So 2 starters 3 mains and 4 pints and paid 90 quid. We will be returning, especially on a sunny day!

title: Brilliant
text: Great way to spend some family time doing indoor climbing! Amazing building (listed II church with beautiful stainglass) and very helpful staff (thank you Luke!). We will definitely be returning!!

title: Wonderfully different!
text: It is exactly what it says. From the atmosphere, the staff, the music and the food. If you are bored of pizzas and pubs then give it a try. We enjoyed everything. We had 4 hot starters, 3 mains, 2 deserts and a carafa of wine. Paid 90 pounds and we will definitely be returning!

title: Beautiful
text: Amazing all around glass cafe at the park side of a beautiful gallery. Avoid lunch times and it should be fine. Loved our mocca. All future business morning meetings will be here form now on. Thank you.

title: Whatever
text: I do not understand what the hip is about. At 19:00 on a Wednesday evening we walked in to be told that we are number 17 on the queue. This meant we finally started eating our pizzas at 21:00. The whole booking system is a joke and an insult. How can anyone plan their evening??? Anyway....the place was extremely noisy and super cold. The staff was smiley but not efficient (forgot orders, didn't check cutlery etc). Pizzas are practically served raw. None of my toppings (tonno pizza) were actually cooked and the dough was shoggy. Overall I am clueless on why this place is advertised as the best pizza around (guess it is all about marketing and hip clientele?). Avoid. I know I will.

title: Awesome!
text: Absolutely beautiful place which we cannot praise enough. Wonderful interior with original features and a stunning terrace. Excellent service on an early Sunday evening. We loved the goats cheese and the beef roast. Service was smooth and friendly. We will definitely be returning...probably for the music festival on the 20th of June.

title: Beautiful!
text: Amazing tapas with a twist. Excellent service and great jazz as a music background. We had 7 tapas, two glasses of wine and two espressos. We paid 40 euros (tip included) and didn't regret a single thing! Highly recommended.

title: Unreal
text: An amazing park. Like an oasis especially in a hot day. Unreal for the serenity and beauty it offers next to the city center. Enjoy!!

title: Don't miss it!
text: It's a market. Like in most Mediterranean cities it a beautiful one, full of colours, scents and unique characters. Enjoy it ... Buy fruit and cheese. Have lunch standing like the locals do. We loved it!

title: Perversidad
text: Beautiful contemporary exhibition of Mujeres Fatales. Do not miss it. The permanent exhibition is not of my taste...too mainstream, but the building is beautiful, as is the coffee shop. For ten euros you will spend a couple of relaxing hours.

title: Small and nice
text: Nice little place for something different in the city center. Only six tables outside and the surrounding taverns are spoiling the mood, but has really decent vegie food with great salads and crepe tapas. We liked the smoothies as well. Service polite and efficient.

title: Nice!!
text: Great small quirky place with decent coffee and nice people. Ideal for a break while exploring the city center!

title: Hidden gem!
text: Amazing service, friendly and efficient! We thoroughly enjoyed our late night wine with octopus and vegetables (yummy!). We will definitely be returning!!

title: Unacceptable
text:
Disgraceful in many ways apart from the views. We booked a table for two to celebrated our anniversary (big mistake!). We were greeted with indifference and shown to our table where the floor was full of cigarette butts. We ordered a bottle of wine, grilled sardines, prawns, octopus vegetables and goat cheese salad. The salad was nice but the rest was barely eatable. Everything felt cooked from frozen. We sent the prawns back (not clean and not cooked properly) and did not touch the octopus (frozen, chewy and excessively salty) and the vegetables. The view was really nice, but no effort was put to that anyway!! We paid 60 euros (they did not charge the offending prawns) and felt ripped off. Avoid!

P.S. Read the other bad reviews and the indifferent managerial responses to get the idea of how this place is run

title: Peterloo exhibition
text: Love this amazing building. Don't miss this exhibition regarding another (it is a long list) of the empire's sad moments.

title: Late night
text: Great place for late night Carribbean food (rather spicy) and cocktails (with not much alcohol in them). Loved the music and the vibe. Beautiful people all around and helpful staff.

title: Excellent
text: Great venue to enjoy a movie. Big screen and amazing sound. Easy to park in the surrounding streets after six. Will be returning!

title: Disappointed
text: No food, no cards accepted, nothing much as a beer garden either. We didn't even bother to try the ales.

title: Great surprise!
text: Came here by chance looking for outdoor seating. We loved it. The back garden is quite and large. We both had fish and a feta platter for starter. Paid 42 quid with two pints Excellent food and really friendly service. We will definitely be returning!!

title: Lovely
text: Beautiful pastry shop with special interest in chocolate. Lovely bread and jams as well. I will be returning to try them all!

title: Great!
text: Nice place for a casual dinner with a huge selection of wine list. The pizzas (tuna and veg) were just great and the atmosphere wonderful.

title: Late night
text: Just came across this place as we arrived late in Rome and were just walking around our neighborhood. We loved it. Food is decent and fairly cheap. Atmosphere is genuine and fun. Service was appropriate.

title: Great food
text: Really great food. Best cioca e pepe we tasted in Rome. Lovely atmosphere as well. No tourists here (which is plus on its own). Only drawback the waiter not speaking a single word in any foreign language. The lovely girl from Bulgaria/Netherlands/France however was there save the day!

title: Really nice
text: Lively little open market with the statue of a very important man in the middle. Enjoy the noise and pay your respect to Giordano Bruno (the era he predicted at the place he was burned).

title: Great when it rains!
text: Nice building. Not too much to see inside unless it's raining. Queue not long, go inside and take a picture of the dome hole. We preferred the fountain outside.

title: Impressive
text: Impressive monument and you cannot miss it as it is very close to the Colosseum. We liked it. Pass by after dark to see the eternal flames burning

title: A must
text: This is a beautiful square and the steps picture is a must. If only we were not asked 58 times to buy something. From roses to selfie sticks. Just ridiculous!

title: Nice one!
text: We loved the square although it was again (like most sites in Rome) extremely crowded. It is a beautiful square full of artists and cafes. Nice fountains.

title: Where is Gina?
text: It a beautiful fountain. It is also so crowded it makes it ridiculous. Better try early in the morning or late in the evening. Best time was when a sudden rainfall made everyone disappear.

title: It's the Colosseum
text: It's great. It's a must for pictures. It's also very crowded and there is nothing exciting inside. Have a look and then head for the city center after taking some pictures of the altar de la patria!

title: Beautiful
text: Amazing little place in every way. Great caring staff (with good English). We sat in the beautiful terrace and enjoyed our brunch. Beetroot humus and cheese selection. We enjoyed our glass of wine and the amazing desserts (chocolate hummus !! and strawberries with yogurt). Definitely recommended!

title: Almost perfect
text: Great atmosphere, service and food choices (apart from the moules). Didn't really fancy the Friday live music though. We will be returning!!

title: Awesome
text: Beautiful little cafe with amazing all day breakfast. Friendly service and nice garden center to enjoy the sunshine. Give it a try!

title: Do not bother
text: Booked one night as was coming to Chester for a gig. Overpriced and noisy with an awful view (ground floor room 22). Yes it is in good location for exploring the old town and it is a very old building. No parking and expensive breakfast. Will not be returning. Ever.

title: Nice mocha
text: Sat outside and enjoyed a great mocha (£3.20) in the sunshine. Busy place. Will try the food next time.

title: Pure joy
text: Amazing place in city center. Great beers and food with original atmosphere. Love the partageurs casserole and chocolate fondue. Definitely will be returning....
